metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29370 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in kmem_cache_alloc_bulk in mm/slub.c in the Linux kernel before 5.5.11. The slowpath lacks the required TID increment, aka CID-fd4d9c7d0c71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29370` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1066-aws - 4.15.0-1066.70
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.70').
